Statements.Statement: Hi. This is the dialog demo.
What is that?
I already know about this.
Who cares? [Rude]
The demo showcases fully data driven conversation! How are you liking it so far?
Oh you do? Are you just here because you like talking? Well what do you think about it? [Friendly]
Wow, you are abrasive! This is what I get for trying? [Agitated]
It's alright.
I want to use it in my project!
It sucks hardcore! [Rude]
Glad you like it!
I know! You can find it at https://github.com/caseydedore/DialogEngine
Anyway... The demo showcases a fully data driven conversation system. Do you even care?
I want to go shooting space pirate nazis like a decent piece of software would let me. [Rude]
Let's end this. I hope I never talk to you again! [Angry]
The demo is here if you want another look. Goodbye.
Seriously?!?
What is really cool is how the Engine can track user specified values that need to persist for the conversation.
The Engine can track user specified values that need to persist for the duration of the conversation.
You're really a jerkass, you know that? Made me mad... thats only partially thanks to you. The rest is thanks to the Engine.
The engine can track values, such as my mood. Yea. Angry.
These values are entirely unknown to the Engine until the user adds one. They can be modified based on the events of the conversation, and used to determine conversation flow.
You're the best, Dialog Engine!
Interesting.
Ok. Boring.
Yuck! Get me OUT OF HERE!
